preface.para: Jmorvi Shek-Pvar, standing between fire and earth, have an affinity for all minerals, but especially metals. Their element is the solid heart of the world, steel and black iron.

Most Jmorvi are artificers; their magic tends to run in a slower vein than that of other Shek-Pvar. The element and its manipulators are powerful and unyielding, but sometimes brittle, insensitive, brutal and shallow. Jmorvi distrust the spiritual believing the soul of humanity to be unpredictable and unreliable. They prefer the sureness and solidity of cold, hard steel.

Several Jmorvi spells can be used to enhance the toughness of materials. Enhancing fully metallic items is easier than enhancing partially metallic or other items. If it is used to enchant armour, then the basic bonus given to the soak of the item is the soak to use if the armour itself is harmed. The soak bonus gained by the wearer of the armour depends on the type of armour being enhanced.
For example, a +30 bonus to a chain hauberk would only give a +12 bonus to the wearer's soak. The same bonus to a metal helm would only give +1.

description.para: A spell to detect and identify metallic minerals. The caster declares a specific metallic mineral and learns the direction to the nearest (single) 'good source'. A small amount of refined metal in close proximity is more noticeable than a large deposit of ore a hundred metres away. Although the spell ignores any Focus through which it is cast, it may detect a companion's sword.

This ward protects a wholly metallic object of up to size 3 from harm. It grants a +15 to soak the next time significant damage (i.e. a soak roll is required) is suffered. The ward then terminates. If it is placed on armour, it only grants one third the protection to the wearer. This ward cannot be stacked with other wards.

This ward will protect a wholly metallic object up to size 5 from harm. The next time the object is harmed, its soak is raised by +30. If the ward is placed on armour, then one third of this bonus is granted to the wearer. This ward cannot be stacked with any other ward.

An enchantment which transforms the surface of a wholly metallic object into another metal. The enchantment is fragile, and, because it only places an extremely thin veneer, transformed objects will not pass more than a cursory inspection. Scratching the object, even with a fingernail, removes some of the plating. The transformation must be to a lower density metal. The maximum weight of the object is 100kg.

An enchantment to increase the weapon quality of a wholly metallic weapon. With success, one statistic (initiative, attack, defence or damage) is increased by 1. This is not cumulative with any other weapon enhancing magic, including rune magic.

spell.name: Sirik's Cant
spell.boost: +15 Can be laid on mostly metallic object
+30 Object can be made to shatter

description.para: An enchantment which causes a wholly metallic object to resonate and grow warmer. This makes the object difficult to use and justifies an immediate penalty of at least 10. The object cannot weight more than 15kg.

spell.name: Anvil of Pytama
spell.boost: +15 Can affect a mostly metallic object

description.para: A minor artifact power installed in a wholly metallic weapon to increase its damage. It cannot be combined with any other enchantment. The weapon does +2 damage.

This spell affects any metallic, stone or crystalline objects of up to size 5. It is a ward which grants a +30 bonus to soak next time the object is harmed. If the object is being used as armour, the wearer gains a +10 bonus to their soak.

An enchantment which infuses the caster's hands with Jmorvi essence, allowing them to strike for real damage. The limbs stiffen only when actually hitting or parrying, so there is no loss of flexibility.

spell.name: Forge of Obras
spell.boost: +30 Can change into a denser metal

description.para: An enchantment to change up to 10kg of metal into a different metal which is less dense.

This spell harden's the skin of the caster, giving her a +15 bonus to soak. The ward comes into affect the next time the caster is injured, and then terminates. It cannot be combined with other wards on the same target.

Grants the caster a +4 to their soak while the spell is being maintained. This spell can be stacked with itself. The skin will take on a slightly darker hue while the spell is in effect, and the toughness of the skin means a -4 penalty to all dexterity and agility rolls.

An enchantment to increase the soak of wholly metallic armour. The soak of such armour is increased by a base of +5, modified by the type of armour. This cannot be combined with another similar enchantment, including rune magic.

An enchantment which toughens the skin to protect like armour. The skin assumes a slight blue-black colour while the enchantment is in place. The caster's soak is increased by 6. This spell can be stacked with itself. The target of the spell suffers a -6 penalty to agility and dexterity rolls while the spell is in effect.
